reference.title: javaparameter
reference.shortdesc: The javaparameter element is a reference to a Java parameter.

section.title: Description
section.p: This element can be used to reference a Java parameter from another topic type.

This element has the following attributes: href, keyref, type, format, scope(local | peer | external), and outputclass. The keyref attribute must provide a unique key such as a fully qualified class name for the named API item.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <task id="httpxml"> <title>Getting an XML file through an HTTP connection</title> <taskbody> <steps> <step><cm>Open the connection</cm> <info>Use this <javaparameter keyref="com.ibm.xtools.ras.export.engine.findElementByName">"container" parameters</javaparameter> for the root element where to perform the search.</info> </step> ... </steps> </taskbody> </task>
